description: '''Michael George Dean''' (born March 1, 1965) is an American record producer, audio engineer, and multi-instrumentalist. He is known for his [[synthesizer]]-heavy [[hip hop production|instrumentation]] and [[Audio mixing (recorded music)|audio mixing]] for high-profile music industry artists. Beginning his career in 1992, he was first credited on releases for Texas-based rappers [[Scarface (rapper)|Scarface]], [[Willie D]], and [[Geto Boys]], though he has since worked with [[popular music|hip hop and pop]] artists including [[Kanye West]], [[the Weeknd]], [[Beyonc√©]], [[Kid Cudi]], [[Travis Scott]], [[Jay-Z]], [[Drake (musician)|Drake]], [[Madonna]], [[Selena Gomez]], [[Playboi Carti]], and [[Lana Del Rey]], among others. As a non-performing lead artist, Dean has released six solo studio albums: ''4:20'' (2020), ''4:22'' (2021), ''Smoke State 42222'' (2022), ''[[4:23]]'' (2023), ''424'' (2024) and ''425'' (2025).
